author: wrowe
msg: Resolve the win32 exec cmd bug, at least as far as some unixes support
it.  Presume the command contains a filepath and transpose forward
slashes to backslashes in the path.  (Note part of the bug, correctly
identified by the poster of 7415, was the /c flag being transposed to \c).
There has to be a better way, but at least this is now partially, and not
entirely broken.  Command.com _does_ accept quoted file paths with spaces

author: dougm
msg: surprised -Wall does not complain, but ap_scan_script_header_err_core() should explicitly return an int

author: martin
msg: Be more strict when --with-tls was given without a DIR value.

author: martin
msg: Try to auto-detect the location of the OpenSSL stuff. The old logic was
incorrect anyway (it tested for .../ssl/ssl.h and then used .../include/ssl.h).
Now we have a configurable list of candidates, each with:
a name, an include path, a lib path, and a list of libs.
